refnamediv.refpurpose: Typed list object (mlist) created for Jimlab and containing data of an image in several fields.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para:
Jimlab defines the type jimage which describes an image (matrix or hypermatrix of pixels with one, three or four layers). Its fields are :
.image
The matrix or hypermatrix with the values of each pixels. The standard format used in Jimlab is uint8 : values are in the range [0,255].
.title
A string of characters containing the title of the image. If the jimage object is created by the fonction jimread(),
.mime
A string of characters containing the file extension : 'png', 'bmp', 'gif' or 'jpg'.
.transparencyColor
This field contains the transparency color of the image.
-1 : There's no transparency color. It's the default value of this field when the jimage object is cr'eated by the function jimread(),
For a grayscale image, an 8-bit unsigned integer is used : gray levels are used for describing a transparent pixel,
For a RGB or RGBA image, a three-layer hypermatrix containing three uint8 values is used. The transparency color is separated in three layers : the first layer contains its Red value, the second layer contains its Green value and the third one contains its Blue value.
This transparency color is modified when the function jimroi() is used. It allows to select an area in an image. When a jimage is exported with jimwrite(), the transparency color is not recorded in the image metadata.
